THE GREAT ADVENTURES NUMBER SEVEN
togs
Albany* July ths Fourth* 1831s What struck me most about the
day was the reading of the Declaration of Independence in the
Methodist Gfturchf that was really a fine spectacles a profound
silence reigned in the meeting* This was not* I assure you* a
theatrical perfomance* There was in the reading of these promises
of independence so well. kepi* in this return of an entire people
toward the memories of its birth* in this union of the present
generation to that which is no longer* sharing for the moment all
its generous passions* there was in all that something deeply
felt and truly great*
